summary: This FBI 302 form documents a telephonic interview conducted on July 22, 2019, with an emergency physician who was on Jeffrey Epstein's private jet in September 2002. The witness describes a trip to Africa focused on HIV research with notable passengers including former President Bill Clinton, Ghislaine Maxwell, and several celebrities. The witness recounts observations of Epstein's behavior, the presence of young women, and suspicious activity involving Maxwell and a bedroom on the plane.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Described as quiet, super wealthy with unknown source of money, and organizer of the private jet trip to Africa for HIV research. Witness observed him following President Clinton and grabbing a woman's buttocks.

persons.name: Bill Clinton
persons.role: Former President of the United States
persons.context: Passenger on Epstein's private jet in September 2002. Gave speeches for HIV research during the trip and had meetings which Epstein attended.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Described as Epstein's former girlfriend and a passenger on the trip. Witness observed her abruptly closing a sliding door to a bedroom on the plane, apparently to conceal activity.

persons.name: David Slade
persons.context: Identified as a staffer for President Clinton who was on the private jet trip in September 2002.

persons.name: Doug Bland
persons.context: Identified as a staffer for President Clinton who was on the private jet trip and had worked out an agreement with Epstein.

persons.name: Kevin Spacey
persons.context: Passenger on Epstein's private jet in September 2002. Witness described him giving 'awkward' hugs.

persons.name: Chris Tucker
persons.context: Passenger on Epstein's private jet in September 2002.

persons.name: Ronald Burkle
persons.context: Passenger on Epstein's private jet in September 2002. Witness had been to his house parties.

persons.name: Casey Wasserman
persons.context: Passenger on Epstein's private jet in September 2002, traveling with his wife.

persons.name: Rodney Slater
persons.context: Passenger on Epstein's private jet in September 2002.

connections.description: Described as former girlfriend and boyfriend. Witness states Maxwell referred to Epstein as her boyfriend and seemed offended when asked about their relationship.
Epstein followed President Clinton around during the trip, attending meetings with him. They traveled together on Epstein's private jet.
Doug Bland had worked out an agreement with Epstein, per the witness statement.
Maxwell was on the trip with four young women aged 20-22. Witness observed her acting suspiciously regarding a bedroom where the women were present.
Epstein traveled with four young women on the trip. Witness observed him grab and rub one woman's buttocks.

events.title: Epstein Private Jet Trip to Africa
events.description: A 10-day trip on Jeffrey Epstein's private jet to seven countries in Africa (Ghana, Nigeria, Rwanda, Mozambique) focused on HIV research. The passenger list included former President Bill Clinton, his staff, celebrities, Ghislaine Maxwell, and several young women.

events.title: FBI Interview of Emergency Physician
events.description: The FBI and AUSA telephonically interviewed an emergency physician who was a passenger on Epstein's 2002 Africa trip. The witness provided details about the trip, the passengers, and suspicious behavior.

events.title: Observation of Suspicious Bedroom Activity
events.description: During the Africa trip, the witness observed Ghislaine Maxwell sitting near a bedroom door on the plane and abruptly closing a sliding wooden door, which the witness interpreted as an attempt to conceal activity in the bedroom.

events.title: Epstein Inappropriately Touches Woman
events.description: The witness observed Jeffrey Epstein grab and rub a woman's buttocks during the Africa trip.

keyFacts: In September 2002, former President Bill Clinton traveled on Jeffrey Epstein's private jet to Africa for an HIV research trip, accompanied by Epstein, Ghislaine Maxwell, staff, celebrities, and several young women.

The witness, an emergency physician on the trip, observed Ghislaine Maxwell abruptly close a sliding door to a bedroom on the plane, which he interpreted as her not wanting him to see or hear what was happening inside.
The witness observed Jeffrey Epstein grab and rub a woman's buttocks during the trip.
Four to five young women, aged 20-22, were on the trip; one was identified as a masseuse, one as a model, and another as a ballerina. Their purpose on the trip was unclear to the witness.

The witness found Epstein 'weird,' noted his quiet demeanor and unknown source of wealth, and found it strange that he traveled with his former girlfriend and several young women with no clear purpose.
